Recipe.title: Cream of Everything Soup
Recipe.Description:
In general, Di doesn't like to eat soup. It isn't that she doesn't like soup, it is just that she wants to eat something else. But, there is one exception: When it is cold, windy and rainy, she feels it is time to eat soup.
One such day, Di and Ransom started debating what kind of soup to make. Di wanted a plain Cream of Broccoli soup. Ransom, on the other hand, was not in the mood for anything plain, so he made up this recipe.

section.title: Soup
section.instruction: Mix Flour and Corn Starch into cold Milk until it is completely dissolved, with no lumps, then set it aside.
Slice Onion into ½&inch; disks, then slice each disk into 4 wedges.
Peel Potatoes and cut into ½&inch; cubes.
Peel Carrots and slice into ¼&inch; thick discs.
Slice Celery into ¼&inch; thick pieces.
Cut Broccoli into marble sized segments. (Use only florets, not pieces of stems.)
In a large pot, melt Butter, then add the Garlic and Onion and sauté until Onion is nearly cooked.
Add Broth, Carrots and Celery, then bring to a boil.
Add Potatoes, and boil until Carrots, Celery and Potatoes are cooked, then reduce heat to medium.
Stir the Milk mixture again, then add Milk mixture, Cream and Broccoli.

Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. This should cause soup to thicken. Then remove from heat.
Toppings:

section.title: Toppings
section.instruction: Cook Bacon until very crispy, then cut (or break) into ¼&inch;-½&inch; squares. I do this by cutting the cooked Bacon once the long way, then cut the skinny strips into squares.
Cut Green Onions into ⅛&inch; thick discs.

Notes.note: You can do work on Toppings while waiting for the soup to come to a boil.

Modifications.modification: You can create the Chicken Broth by using 4 Cups of Water + 4 Bouillon Cubes (or the equivalent).
Do NOT use Celery if Di is eating with you.
You can use gluten-free Flour if desired.
Add 1 teaspoon of minced fresh Parsley. (Not dried!)
For a little zing, try ½ teaspoon Cayenne Pepper, or serve Hot Sause as a "topping".
